chargeHist.descr: Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury

result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles A Oliver was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(2r).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.

Court finds that if the Defendant successfully completes probation and has no new criminal law violations, Court will find that it is in the Defendant's interest to have this expunged and society will not be harmed and grant expunction.

No contact with co-defendant except as allowed by the Agent.
Attend Anger Management classes.
Write an apology letter to the Officer.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes:
Condition Time - STRAIGHT TIME. 63 days credit. FORTHWITH.
Last 30 days STAYED and to be used at Agent's discretion as well as to huber or straight time.
Perform as a Condition of Probation.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs.
Sentence credit of 367 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with co-defendant except as allowed by the Agent.  Anger Management.  Write a letter of apology to the Officer.  Obtain GED/HSED.  Maintain full time employment and/or school combination.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by the Agent. 
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Court previously ordered $268.00 Court Costs and $250.00 DNA Surcharge.  Balance to be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

superTimeConds.notes: To be performed as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

records.descr: Remittitur/Court of Appeals dec & order affirming

records.addlTxt:
Certified Copy:
IT IS ORDERED tht the judgment of the circuit court is summarily affirmed pursuant to WIS. STAT. RULE 809.21.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Christopher Sobic is relieved of further representation of Charles Oliver in this matter.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published.
records.descr: Court of Appeals decision & order affirming

records.addlTxt:
Charles Oliver appeal frim a judgment sentencing him after revocation of his probation for resisting an officer and causing substantial bodily harm/soft tissue injury as party to the crime contrary to WIS. STAT. 946.41(2r).  Oliver's appellate counsel filed a no-merit report pursuant to WIS. STAT. RULE 809.32.  Oliver received a copy of the report and an independant review of the record as mandated, we summarily affirm the judgment because there are no issues that would have arguable merit for appeal.

IT IS ORDERED tht the judgment of the circuit court is summarily affirmed pursuant to WIS. STAT. RULE 809.21.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Christopher Sobic is relieved of further representation of Charles Oliver in this matter.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published.
Letter from Atty Sobic advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.
Filed by the Court of Appeals acknowledging receipt of court record.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Charles A Oliver in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  The Defendant was sentenced on revocation as follows:

IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

4 YEARS 6 MONTHS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT -367 days)
  -  1 YEAR 6 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  3 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  

Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. 
Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.   
No contact with co-defendant except as allowed by the Agent. 
Anger Management. 
Write letter of apology to the Officer.   
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
Defendant to perform 100 hours of community service as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
*Obtain GED/HSED.

COURT COSTS: Court previously ordered $268.00  (balance to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

DNA SURCHARGE:  Court previously order $250.00 (balance to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 16, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Charles A Oliver in court, in custody, with  Legal Intern Megan Gokey for attorney Katie B. Bricco.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Charles A Oliver in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 3.  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following: 
Ct.  3:
- Withheld sentence for 2 years Probation
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation:  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.   No contact with co-defendant except as allowed by the Agent. Anger Management. Write letter of apology to the Officer.   Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
- Defendant to perform 100 hours of community service as a Condition of Probation.
- 120 days jail straight time Condition Time - 63 days credit - commencing FORTHWITH. Last 30 days STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion. Huber/Straight time to be used at the Agents discretion. 

Defense requests expunction.
State responds.
Court finds that if the defendant successfully completes probation and has no new criminal law violations, Court will find that it is in the defendant's interest and  society will not
be harmed and grant expunction.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 3, 2015 at 10:30 am.
